links.*: The Lost Road and Other Writings

wikitext.*:
'''TOL''' is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "stick out or up" or "stick up, stand up (stiff), raise the head".<ref name=VT47>{{VT|47a}}, p. 28 (root appearing as "TOL")</ref>

==Derivatives==

*[[Quenya]]: ''[[tol]]''<ref name=VT47/>
*[[Sindarin]]: ''[[tol]]''<ref name=VT47/>

*?[[Telerin]]<ref>[[Thorsten Renk]],  [https://tolkienlistsearch.herokuapp.com/message/5e9c35f6e141f533245668ee "Telerin in VT47 and elsewhere" (325.55)] (dated 18 October 2005) at [[Elfling]] (mailing list)</ref>/?[[Quenya]]:<ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]], "[http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm Quettaparma Quenyallo]" at [http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/ Ardalambion] (accessed 17 June 2011)</ref> ''[[tolma]]''<ref name=VT47/>

==Other versions==

In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']] appears the root TOL<sup>2</sup>, from which derives:<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 394 (root appearing as  "TOL<sup>2</sup>-"</ref>

*[[Primitive Quendian]]: ''tollo''
**Quenya ''tol''
**[[Noldorin]]: ''[[toll]]''

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root TOLO, yielding a variety of derivatives (among them [[Qenya]] ''tolome'' "island" and ''tolda'' "hill with a flat top, town on a hill").<ref>{{PE|12}}, p. 94</ref>

{{references}}
